summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) dated November 26, 2021, outlining the upcoming week's schedule. The primary focus is the imminent start of the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, noting the assigned prosecutors, judge, and expected timeline.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: Recipient of the internal email providing a weekly schedule update for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the trial 'U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell' which is scheduled to begin the week of November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge before whom the Ghislaine Maxwell trial is pending.

connections.description: Williams, as U.S. Attorney, oversees the office prosecuting Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal trial.

events.title: Start of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: Trial begins in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecution will exercise peremptory strikes and deliver opening statements. The trial is expected to last 4-6 weeks.

keyFacts: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on Monday, November 29, 2021.
The trial was expected to last 4-6 weeks and was pending before Judge Nathan.
The email is an internal scheduling update from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating the high-level coordination for the Maxwell case.
The identities of the assigned Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) are redacted in the document text.
The document reflects the operational planning within the prosecutor's office just days before the high-profile trial commenced.
